meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes disruption or disturbance.
meanings.sent1: The loud disruptors in the classroom made it hard to focus on the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected fire alarm was a disruptor during the school assembly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous disruptors decided to play a prank on their teacher.
meanings.sent4: The disruptors in the form of construction noise disrupted the peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The disruptors of the peace were swiftly dealt with by the authorities.

meanings.definition: Something that interrupts the normal course or unity of something.
meanings.sent1: The sudden power outage was a disruptor to the meeting schedule.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain became a disruptor for the outdoor picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: The misbehaving disruptors of the group project caused chaos in the team.
meanings.sent4: The disruptors of progress were identified and addressed by the management.
meanings.sent5: The disruptors in the system were causing delays in the production line.
